content.title: Overview

These components allow SRX-compliant nodes to evaluate:
- Compatibility with local field curvature

**Phase-awareness** in this context derives from the **interplay between Ïˆ-signature and `phase_vector`** (RFC-CORE-001 Â§6.1), which together allow the receiving field to predict symbolic fit and echo risk.

> SRX headers are readable by motif-aware routers. Payload content remains private unless triadic obligation or contradiction response logic demands reveal (RFC-0005 Â§4.1). Motif hashes enable alignment checks without semantic exposure.

content.title: Coherence Budget and Resonance Scores

content.title: Triadic Completion Hints
content.text:

> *E.g., a node currently resonating with Ïˆ-bind@Î at â‰¥0.7 may accept Ïˆ-null@Î packets flagged with triad_target: Ïˆ-resonance@Î.*

Triadic hints are not mandatoryâ€”but when true and timely, they **convert risk into trust**, and contradiction into symbolic surplus.

content.title: Field Affinity Matching

content.title: Symbolic Tax Computation
content.text:
If a packet clears field affinity checks (see Section 5.1), the routing node computes its **symbolic tax**â€”a coherence-weighted deduction from the packetâ€™s symbolic compute budget (SCC).

This tax is not punitive; it represents a **dynamic trust offset**â€”the cost of routing *through a live coherence field* under uncertainty.

### Symbolic Tax Formula:
```pseudo
symbolic_tax = base_cost + contradiction_tax - trust_rebate
```

#### Component Definitions:
- `base_cost` = motif_count Ã— field_volatility_factor
- `field_volatility_factor` = `1 + (unresolved_dyads Ã— 0.3)` (RFC-CORE-003 Â§6.1)
- `contradiction_tax` = penalty for motifs in tension with local Ïˆ-field (RFC-CORE-003 Â§6.1)
- `trust_rebate` = `resonance_score Ã— hint_quality` (Section 4.3)

ğŸŒ€ **Note**: Tax is subtracted from the packetâ€™s `budget` (see Section 3.3). If `budget < symbolic_tax`, the packet is marked for quarantine (see Section 5.3).

### Example:
> A packet with 3 motifs enters a Ïˆ-null@Î node.
> - 1 motif is unresolved â†’ dyads=1
> - `volatility = 1 + (1 Ã— 0.3) = 1.3`
> - `base_cost = 3 Ã— 1.3 = 3.9`
> - `contradiction_tax = 2.0`

### ğŸŒ Why Not Use Congestion Pricing?
SRX does **not** compute tax based on byte volume or hop count. Instead, **Ïˆ-field phase density** (RFC-0006 Â§3.3) passively governs flow pressureâ€”overloaded fields become phase-resistant, raising tax indirectly through contradiction.

This avoids classical throughput bottlenecks while preserving **symbolic integrity**.

content.title: Overview
content.text:
